options.text: Insertional inactivation technique helps in identification of the recombinant transformants with non-transformants by forming colourless colonies.
Insertional inactivation of <math><mi>β</mi><mo>-</mo></math> galactosidase leads to the formation of colourless colonies.
Insertional inactivation of <math><mi>β</mi><mo>-</mo></math> galactosidase leads to the formation of blue color colonies.
In insertional inactivation, the <math><mtext>rDNA</mtext></math> is inserted within the coding sequence of an enzyme <math><mi>β</mi><mo>-</mo></math> galactosidase.

solution.text: Selection of recombinants due to inactivation of antibiotics is a cumbersome procedure. Therefore, alternative selectable markers have been developed, which differentiate recombinants from non-recombinants on the basis of their ability to produce colour. A recombinant <math><mtext>DNA</mtext></math> is inserted within the coding sequence of enzyme <math><mi>β</mi><mo>-</mo></math>galactosidase. This results in insertational inactivation, and the colonies do not produces any colour.
